result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarod Luke Petersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Submit DNA sample. Complete Columbia County Drug Treatment Court. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Bond on hand will be used towards costs.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and Stayed to be used as need by treatment court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarod Luke Petersen

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Filed by Attorney Peter Middleton

9:39 AM Cases called; 22CF498 and 22CF442. Defendant Jarod Luke Petersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Jarod Luke Petersen.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 22CF498. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in. 22CF442 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 36 months. Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. 30 days jail with Huber, imposed and stayed to be used as need by treatment court. Complete Columbia County Drug Treatment Court. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs from either case. 10:01 AM
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Crooks- Mishacoff

3:23 PM Defendant Jarod Luke Petersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch in court for Jarod Luke Petersen. Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 3:25 PM
